newsitem.title: UK: Japan's Muji says to expand after j-v ends.
newsitem.headline: Japan's Muji says to expand after j-v ends.

text.p: Japanese retailer Muji said on Tuesday that it would boost the number and size of its stores in Britain and expand into Europe from the current four London shops.

Earlier on Tuesday, British retailer Liberty Plc said it would sell its 49 percent stake in Muji, which is a "no brand" retailer, to its joint venture partner Ryohin Keikaku, part of Japan's Saison Group.

Shingo Kawanokami, general manager of Ryohin Keikayu's international division, said in a statement that the move would allow the company to build "on the progress we have made since our first UK store opened in 1991."
Ryohin Keikaku has 239 stores worldwide with sales of 48.9 billion yen ($394.9 million) in the year ending February 29, 1996 and pretax profits of 3.9 billion yen.
